Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		Answer: A<n><n>### Input::Which is a characteristic of Google Classroom technology and software? Choices: A: easy to understand software B: low-cost software C: easy-to-find information on the web D: all of the above<n><n>### Response::Answer: A and D<n><n>### Input : Which of the following is a way to create a visual cue for a reader? Choices A: a headline B: a callout box C: a graph D: an image E: all of the above.<n><n>### Response Answer: A,B,C,E<n><n>### Input Which of the following is an option available for a reader when highlighting text in Google Docs? Choices A: change fonts B: change the paragraph C: change the page D: change the color E: choose all above<n><n>### Answer to the Questions:<n>### Instruction Read the sentence provided, substitute the underlined phrase with a phrase from page 119.<n>This picture shows 6 red balloon blowers and 7 blue.<n><n>### Phrase to substitute: 59 more red balloon blower than blue<n><n>### Instructions: Read the given sentence, substitute the underlined pronoun with one that makes the sentence correct.<n>I got 27 apples from my grandmother's orchard with 24 of them being green.<n><n>### Pronoun to substitute: 24<n><n>### Instructor : <n>Which type of research question results in a direct answer? Choices: A) closed-ended B) open-ended C) Both are closed ended D. Both are open ended E: It depends on the project<n><n>A: closed-ended B: open-ended F: It depends on the research<n><n>### Instuction : Read the paragraph below and answer the underlined question. What is the primary reason an author can choose to use one of the types of transition words as described? Choices: A. to help the reader know why the transition word is used. B. to help the reader understand it's true meaning. C. to help the reader visualize the concepts in the sentence. D. to help the reader not become distracted by a grammatical error. E. to help the reader see how much information that is in the sentence.

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The forgotten leftovers had gotten quite old, he found it covered in mold in the back of his what? (Extra credit is not required).<n><n>### Extension:<n>If your program returns the expected but incorrect answer, modify the instructions to correctly return the other option available

(I'm in 4th grade, btw.) I tried looking for answers online without success. Could someone please try to explain to me how to do  these problems?<n><n><br><n>This is supposed to be a quiz. I will give my answers, and someone please explain to me how they reached that conclusion. Thanks so much!<n><n><n><n>### Input<n><n><p>&pi; squared/4 = 1.57079634...</p><n><n>### Response<n><p>It's the square root of the answer.</p><n><n><p>If you take the whole answer, and divide it by four, then add <i>π</i> to the answer, it's one.</p><n><n><n><n>## <n>The student that is currently doing this math explained it to me as follows:<n><n>### Instrument:<n><n>### Inputs:<n>The students first explains that when you know the area of a circle and want to find the radius, you do the inverse, which is square root.<n><n>### Response:"\n1 √6^2 =3\n2√32^2=1.33\n3 sqrt 24 =9.97\n4 sqrt 28=14.97"<n><n><br>There is a little misunderstanding. The inverse is not a direct answer. The inverse of 4 is 1/4 or 0.25. It's not two-third. <n><n>I have no idea if this was a spelling mistake or something.

Choices:  A: going to jail B: going to prison C: beat him up D: get arrested E: die<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n><n>### Input/Output: The following example is in the form of an algorithm that contains multiple arithmetic operations for solving part a:<n><n>Input:  n = 548857, x<n><n>Operation: (2^x + 5) * (2^21 - 3)<n><n>Output: 100779049<n><n>Input: 0 < n > 0, x = (the largest power of 2 that is <= n/x)<n><n>Operation: (Ai * Bi) * (x^y)<n><n>Output: (B * An)<n><n>If the output of the two previous functions is greater than the original integer n, then return the original value n instead of the result of the last function.<n><n>If the output is less than or equal to n, return the result of the last two functions.<n><n>### Response/Output: Write a Python program that reads numbers from a file containing a list of integers and prints the greatest and smallest number in the file.<n><n>- First read the numbers from a text file containing a list of 3 or more pairs of numbers from an endless stream of integers separated by a - (dash) sign.<n><n>- Calculate the largest and smallest number in the stream by comparing pairs of numbers that are separated by - sign.<n><n>- Save the largest and smallest numbers as the output to a separate text file.<n><n>### Description:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: n = 543857, x = 1<n><n>Output: (2^1 + 5) * 2^(21 - 3), 10476<n><n>Input: 1 < n > 0<n><n>Output: 0, since n is smaller than 0.<n><n>Output:<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input / Output: The following example is a graph of a function. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What is a grumpy person likely to have? Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		<n>If we are talking about a grumpy person, they are not likely to have happiness. They might be having headache or understanding themselves.<n><n>### Input<n>Josh likes ice cream. He eats 1/5 of a pint of ice cream each day on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. On Saturday, Friday, and Sunday, he eats only 1/12 of a pint of icecream each day. If he eats the same amount one day as on the next, how many pints (in all) does Josh eat in 15 days?<n><n>### Response<n>If you are talking about Josh likes ice cream, the pints (in all), then the Josh eats 12 one day and the next day he eat 5 which is less than the total number of his own day (12). Thus he eat the 12 pints in 15 days.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>Based on our instruction that we have, the answer to our question below is answered correctly and appropriate.

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where would a person keep a book while it's being read? Choices:  A: closet B: library of congress C: classroom D: in bed E: desk<n><n>### Response:		If someone reads a book in a classroom, then they would keep the book in their desk.<n><n>### Output:<n>Your answer is correct.<n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Though it stayed strictly indoors, the small dog felt like it had all the space in the world in the what? Choices:  A: living room B: dog park C: basket D: small apartment E: big house<n><n>### Response:		dog park<n><n>### Input and response:What might they say about this room? Choices: A: It's spacious. B: It has a lot of natural light. C: It's really comfortable. D: It's really dark.<n><n>### Response option 1: spacious<n><n>### Input 2: What might they say about this piece of art? Choices: A. I love this style! B. It reminds me of my childhood. C. It looks like the artist used a lot of different techniques. D. I can see myself hanging this somewhere in my apartment.<n><n>### Option 2: It reminds me of childhood<n><n><n><n><n><n>

If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? I lost his shoes, didn't know where they landed, and had to run from the corner store to his home.  About where did he run? Choices:  A: a bed of nails B: town C: attractive consistent look D: city block E: ground<n><n>### Response:		Bob is on the corner of Nutrition St. and Pineapple St. He walked Nutrition st. from Nutrition corner to Nutrition Pineapple, left Pineapple St. and went West on Nutrition st., continued north on Nutrition St., until he arrived at nutrition avenue.<n><n>### Output: He walked 5 blocks from the corner store to the bus garage. He rode the bus for 20 blocks to The post office to get stamps. He finally came home to his house the same way he went.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>In this instruction, there are four sub-instructions.<n><n>The first instruction: Bob's feet hurt from being bare-foot on the hot pavements<n><n>The second instruction: I lost his shoes<n><n>The third instruction: didn't know where the shoes landed, and had the run from the corner store<n><n>The fourth instruction: to his home<n><n>We have three options: A, B, and C. I will explain option A. Option A is a sentence. Bob's feet hurt. A foot is a part of a leg. A leg is to run.<n><n>Because I lost his shoes. I don't have a shoe? Why? Option C, I didn't know where his shoe landed. The landed is a place.<n><n>Option D, city block, refers to a unit of measure in a city or town. If the answer is 17, it means there were 17 city blocks. There is a building here, there are people who go around.<n><n>Options E, Ground is land, or I didn't know how to run.<n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What could a massive building be if it is not constructed well? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		A - Answer:  B: Squash court<n><n>### Instructions:<n>In your response, state if you agree or disagree and explain why you have that opinion.<n><n>### For example: I agree. The squash court has all the amenities.<n><n>### Your response must contain more than 1 sentence.<n><n>### You are free to use a dictionary if you need to.<n><n>### Please do no use a search engine for any research.<n><n>### Read more about [Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion](https://www.edX.org/course/diversity-equity-inclusion/edx/)<n>

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What common chemical reaction is often used as a heat source? Choices:  A: coal or wood B: fire C: lava D: house E: solar energy<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Inputs:Minerals, rocks, water, and sediments can form landforms over many years. Which combination of rock types is most likely to create these landforms?A: a small boulder, a granite boulder, pumice, and a small rocky hill<n>B: an igneous rock, another sedimentary rock, a igneous rock, and a lava field<n>C: limestone, a sedimentary rock, clay, and sandstone<n>D: pumice, another igneous rock, granite, and boulders<n><n>### Response:(B)<n><n>### Instructions:Choose one of the numbers in the range 0-9 and then, using the rules noted, figure out which of the numbers in the answer range also fits the rule.<n><n>### Rule 1. Add _a_ to the number _n_<n><n>### Rule2. Subtract 1 from each digit in the number _n_, and then divide by 10.<n><n>### Example: 7 + a = 74<n><n>### The correct answer is: 6<n><n>### Input 2<n><n>### Rule1 _n_ = 14<n><n>### Rule3 _9 =_ _5_<n><n>### The answer is 125.<n><n>### The final result is 125<n><n>### Rule _3_ = 3<n><n>### Example 2: 3 _n 9 is 46_.<n><n>### The only option is 46.<n><n>### Input _5: The rules are_<n><n>#! /usr/bin/env bash<n><n>#!/bin/bash<n><n>[[ "$#" -eq 0 ]] && echo "\nMissing data\n" && exit 1;<n><n>source "$(dirname "$0")"; source "$(dirname "$0" "/scripts/.env")";<n><n>declare -ag EXT<n>declare -ag INPUTS<n><n>EXT=( ".sh" )<n><n># Check if the $1 variable is a.sh file<n>if [[ "$1" =~ \.sh$ ]]; then<n>   INPUTS=$(( (BASHARG-1) - 0 )) &&<n>   ARGV0="$

"the battlefield"<n><n>### Input 2:Sam bought food for their next camping trip and calculated the quantities he should make:<n>for his 4-person family, he had 100 servings of chicken stew, 190 servings of potatoes with chives, and 79 servings of bread, and 21 servings of blueberries.<n><n>He had 71 servings of bread total, and for each serving of stew and potatoes, he had 3 servings of blueberrries.<n>After he was finished, he and his family set out on their camping trip. How much food did he bring?<n><n>### Response 2:The choice that best answer this question is A: ANSWER: 1348 4 - 100 * 4 + 4 * 71 + 21 = 9 + 22 + 22 = 45 + 22 = (134 + 6) 1348<n><n>### Input3:A friend of a friend at a convention found a hotel with rooms for each day in the following weeks: Monday: Hotel 300 Tuesday: Hotel 200 Wednesday: Hotel 350 Thursday: Hotel 30 Friday: Hotel 250<n><n>The friend and his friend decided to stay in the hotel for all but Friday, the day after the convention. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where would a special ficus be found? Choices:  A: pointed B: bright C: easy D: clear E: acute angled<n><n>### Response:		A is the correct choice. Answer: A is the correct option. The best description of a mathematical obtuse document would be sharp or pointed in an angled way. It is also possible to describe obtuse as being at an angle that looks like a V. In geometry, obtuse means having angles that are larger than 90 degrees.<n><n>### Evaluation:<n>Give the correct answer option or multiple choice question.

Write your answer on the space provided.<n><n>### Response E<n><n>### Instractions<n>Input: Dianne went into the office at the library to do some work. She found a book about dinosaurs to read during the weekend. After 1 hour of reading, she felt much more relaxed. She decided to buy some books about dinosaurs and read them when she had spare time. This model allows to model binary response variables by predicting the log odds of a variable and is more suitable for data with small sample size.<n>

Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer will be: D <n><n>### Input :At a party, 3 people were drinking wine and beer, respectively, and 2 others were drinking both. One person was given wine, one person was given soda, and one person was given both. If there were 11 people at the party, how many took wine?<n>The correct answer will be E. (3+3+2) 9 people took wine. <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following yes-no question.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Input: What is the most common color of a fire hydrant's stand?<n><n>* [0/1] red or blue<n>* [1/1] red<n><n>###Input:The fire hydrant's color is:<n><n>If the color input value is 0, then the fire hydrant's name is red<n>After which output:<n><n>Output: The fire hydrant is red<n><n>If the color value is 1, then the fire hydra's name is blue<n>After which output: <n><n>Output: The Fire hydrant's name blue<n><n>### Instrument: answer the following yes-no questions.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Input: If a person does well in school, they will be promoted to more advanced studies.<n><n>if the input value is 0(zero)<n>After that, output:<n><n>output: True <n><n>if the input is 1(one)<n>After that, the output<n><n>output:  false <n><n><n>## Instruction :answer the following questions.<n><n>## Input:How many hours did you spend on the computer today? <n><n>###  Multiple choice: Choose the correct response.<n><n>If the input value is 10 or more hours <n>Then your answer:<n><n>**[0/1] 10 hours or more**<n><n>If the input is 9 hours or less <n>The answer is false<n><n><n>## Direction: In the following multiple choice question, choose the correct response.<n><n>## Instruction<n>**For this question,** **the input value is** **negative** **one(1).** <n><n>### Multiple choice: Choose a response.<n><n>|    0    |    1    |<n>| :-----: | :-----: |<n>|

Choices:  A: throw things B: play sports C: play games D: play ball E: play chess<n><n>### Response:		(A) Throw things is one-word: throw.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```javascript<n>  let answers = {"t": ["throw","throws"],"s":["play"],"p":["throws"],"b":["throw"]};<n>  function solve(x){<n>    let answer = x;<n>    for(let i in answers){<n>      let word1=answers[i];<n>      answer += (i?", ":"")+word1;<n>    }<n>    return answer;<n>  }<n>  let input = "The parents thought their children  should learn teamwork";<n>  console.log(solve(input));<n>```<n><n>### Input : What is the difference between 40 percent of 70 and 70 percent of 80?<n><n>### Response : (-35%,+5%)<n><n><n>```javascript<n>  function solve(s){<n>    if(s.end()[0]=='-'){<n>      return s.split(" ")[0]+" is "+s.split(" ")[1];<n>    }<n>    else{<n>      let word=s.split(" ");<n>      return word[1]+" is "+word[0];<n>    }<n>  }<n>```<n><n><n>---<n>> ## Task<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions about the following set.<n><n>### Input 1: This set has 85 elements.<n><n>In this set it is possible an element may occur more than once and also it has a specific order that a subset of elements have to reside in the index with the 82nd element.<n><n>What are the next two elements?<n><n>#### Answer : 77 and 82<n><n>### Instructios:Answer the following multiplechoice question.<n><n>## Input 2: There are 265641 pieces of candy in the barrel. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The cow would come outside even after the storm had passed, it wouldn't leave the what? Choices:  A: meat grinder B: stable C: red barn D: gate E: green field<n><n>### Response:		Choice: B A: meat grinder<n>### Response: B A: meat what?<n>### Response: A meat what

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n><n>### Response:		Refrigerator<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the questions below.<n><n>### 1. You’ll need to select the options that are related to the question above. The choice you make is used to draw an inference about the scenario.<n><n>### Select the option that is not related and move on to the next question.<n><n>1. What is the name of the animal?  A: Pig B: Cow C: Piglet<n>2. What happened to it?  A: ran away, B: ate it, C: it’s dead, D: someone put it in a box<n>3. What is the color of the fruit it’s inside of?  A: green, B: red, C: orange, D: blue<n>4. What is the color he bought?

If the ratio of people who drink coffee at least occasionally to those who never drink coffee is 11:2, what is the total number of people surveyed?<n><n>### Answer: 49<n><n>### Input 96<n>##demostrate:<n>Input: 96 and multiply by................and put as your answer<n>### Output?<n>Answer: <n><n>### Input A:<n>##demostrate A:<n><n>Ans: 96<n><n>### Input B:<n>##demostrte B:<n>Input 96 x .5<n>Answer: 48<n><n>### Input C:<n>##demostra C:<n>Input: Multiply.4 and ...as answer<n>Answer: 36<n><n>### Output A:<n>Answer: 748<n><n>##demostrate answer:<n>96 x 5/9<n>Answer: <n>`<n>

Choices:  A: alert B: deep sleep C: drink coffee D: open eyes E: conscious<n><n>### Response:		Answer A<n><n>### Input:[22, 24, 25, 26, 27, 32, 45, 70, 90]<n><n>### Demaration:For each sequence the next number is obtained by adding 5 to the previous number, so the sequence above is just 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, and so on.<n><n>### Response:[27, 30,70]<n><n>## Input:[19.5,9,48,17,28]<n><n>## Demaration:Using this sequence, write a program for the computer so that it finds the average from this sequance and the average of every sequence it receives thereafter until it receives 101,208 as follows: 1/19.5 + 1/9, 1/48, 1/17, 1/28, 1/57<n><n>## Response:[20.166667,20.277778,28.111111,82.833332,2083.33309]<n><n>### Input:(70, 2205) -> (5857,89.5)<n><n>### Demarration:Let the first number be 70 and the second be sum 2205. To find each number on the list as follows: 70+70=140, 22*3 = 66(3*1,6,6,6,57+57), 2205=22*2200+22*5, 2200+5=2195+5=2143+5, 66+20=59+5=64+5=69+s(5)=69+57+5 =140(7,5)<n><n>## Response:(90,1089) -> (58,6546)<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A water spout was seen in the ocean off the coast of what? Choices:  A: florida B: basement C: sink D: beach E: fountain<n><n>### Response:		Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n><n>#### Question<n><n>There are 19 gumballs in Gumball's gumball dispenser. Ginger takes three gumballs. How many gumballs are left in the dispenser after Ginger took the three gumballs?<n><n>#### Explanation<n><n>Input: Ginger had 20 gumballs<n><n>Output: ginger had 6 gumballs left in the dispenser<n><n>### Output:<n><n>#### Question<n>A. If Ginger took three, Ginger had eight. <n>B. If Ginger took five, then Ginger had four. <n><n>#### Instruction<n>Answer the following<n>1. Choose a response that correctly provides an answer to the input.<n>2. Explain how the solution follows from the instruction.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The output was to follow the question.<n>The answer was Ginger had 8 gumballs.<n>The solution to this problem did not require the use of any formula or algorithm.

Choices:  A: supermarket B: home C: closet D: mart E: hardware store<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the question by filling in the blank space below.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>### Choice B<n><n>Choice A: The grocery shopping is done at a grocery store, where a shopping bag is selected for packing the groceries. If a bag is selected, the shopping takes place there.<n><n>Choice B: The groceries come from one or more stores. The bag is selected in the home. By selecting from existing bags at homes, a single bag is selected.<n><n>Choice C: Groceries are not selected in the grocery store before placing them in a shopping bag. A bag is selected for a single shopping before placing the groceries inside it.<n><n>Choice D: If the groceries come from home, a shopping bag is not selected. Groceries come from one source only, so it is not a grocery store.<n><n>Choice E: At a grocery store or at home, a shopping happens. A bag is selected before groceries are placed in it.<n><n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. Choices:  A: earth B: movie C: party D: served cold E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Choice: D – served cold**<n><n>### Reason:<n>**Step 1:**<n>If the ice cream was served at the party, then the ice cream would be served by _________.<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>* Choice: D – _serviced_<n>* Choice: A – _sweat or_<n>* Choice B – _a freezer_<n>* Choice C – _a movie_ (Ice cream should be served during a party and not at a movie or on the planet Earth)<n><n>### Step 2:<n>What could the ice cream served by? __HINT__: Choose the best description from the choices.<n><n>#### Examplenation:<n>* Choices: A: served a la mode (a la mode suggests the ice cream is served with whip cream.)<n>* Choices: B: served over hardened cookies (It is difficult to imagine ice cream served over hardened cookies.)<n>* Choices C: served in a large glass container<n>* Choices: D – served by a lady.<n><n>What would happen if the ice cream not be served at a party?<n><n>#### Explanantion:<n>* Choices A: The ice cream will be froze.<n>* Choices B: The ice cream would be eaten at the party<n>* Choices C and D: The party and the ice cream will be gone.<n><n>### Step3<n>Is the ice cream served at the movie?<n><n>#### Examantion:<n>* Correct answer: No<n>* Choices:<n>    * Choice A: No. (It will be served at the party.)<n>    * Choice B: Yes. (It is served from the movie, like popcorns or coke)<n>    * Choices C: No. (The ice cream will be served at the freezer.)<n>    * Choices D: No. (It is served over hardened cookies, which also can be served at the party, the movie, or the freezer.)  <n><n>### Step4<n>Choose the best answer<n>    <n><n>What might be served on top of the ice cream?<n><n>#### Explantion:<n>    * Choices A: Cookies or brownies<n>    * Choice C: hot fud

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where might a yard be tiny? Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the analogies according to the rules listed below.<n><n>### Rule #1:When two words in an analogy are synonyms, only one may be changed.<n><n>### Example: The difference between "pier" and "wharf" is that:<n><n>### A: "pier" is a type of wharf. B: a pier is a wharf with a pier. C: "wharf" is a type of pier. D: a pier is a piers different from a wharf.<n><n>### The correct answer is:<n><n>### "Pier" is a type a wharf"<n><n>### Rule#2:When a synonym of a key word has been used in an analogy, only the synonym of a key can be changed.<n><n>Ex: In: "Healthy: A type of wealthy." ___wealthy_ is a key word. So then the answer is "wealthy:A type of healthy.”<n><n>### Example 1: In: "Living: a type of lifting." ____living_ is a key word then the answer should be ____lifting: a type of living.”<n><n>### Answer 1: ____living:A type of lifting”<n><n>### Example2: In: "Laundromat : A type of _." ___laundromat_ is a key word, so the answer should be "laundromat: A type of _."<n><n>### Answer2: "Laundrolat: a type of _."<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a paper program? Choices:  A: theater B: computer C: opera D: television E: concert<n><n>### Response:		<n>**A:** The program was on a computer<n><n>### Instructions:If Samantha is twice as likely to buy candy as chips, how many more people choose candy than chips if 80 people are in the candy line and 62 are in the chips line?<n><n>### Instructon:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration:Input: In a store, there are 31 bags of chips, 19 bags of pretzels, and 43 bags of cookies. If each bag has 18 pretzels, 26 cookies, and 24 chips, what is the total number of treats?<n><n>A: The total number of treats is 851<n><n>Input: B: If the same store offers 1 bag of chips for every 2 bags of pretzles and 4 bags of cookies, how many bags of chips will a child get?<n><n>B: The child will get 9 bags of chips.<n><n><n>## Solution: Input: In a school there are 5 more girls than boys. There are twice as many boys as girls in a particular class. If there are a total of 5 boys in the school how many students are in this class?<n>A: The answer is 120 students.

Choices:  A: drinking B: intimacy C: dancing D: happiness E: enjoyment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>B)<n><n>### Input<n><n>Sally bought 6 strawberries on a trip to the mall, 4 were stolen at the counter, and 1 was given away to a friend. If she has 3 strawberries left, how many strawberries did Sally buy?<n><n>### Response<n>A. 6<n><n>### Demand<n><n>#### Part 1<n><n>Daisy has 10 pounds of flour, 2 pounds of sugar, and 1 box of starch. She uses 1/4 of the flour, 1/4 of each of the starch and sugar, and uses the extra sugar and starch together to complete a product. If she creates 1 pound of the product, how many pounds of starch does Daisy have left?<n><n>Part 2<n><n>Hector bought 11 pound of dog food and 3 pounds of vitamin pellets for his dog. He feeds his dog 1/2 of the dog food plus 2/3 of the vitamin pellets. How much does his dog eat in all?<n><n>Part 3<n><n>Sue bought 6 pounds of carrots, 8 pounds of onion, 12 pounds of bell peppers, 9 pounds of broccoli, and 16 pounds of potatoes to cook a dinner for her family. Which of the following shows how many pounds of each vegetable Sue will cook? Choices: A, B, C<n><n>B<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write three sentences that describe a situation in which a task that requires two parts could be described by the phrase “the first minus the second”. Make a drawing that illustrates one part of the task.<n><n>### My answers<n><n>1,2,6;8,11,12,13<n><n>-1/2 x 10 =5(half of 10)<n><n>-1/4 x 10 =2.5 (1/4 of 10)

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Why would professionals playing sports not be able to compete? Choices:  A: pain B: mudslide C: sweating D: injuries E: rain<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is letter D.<n>### Demonstraion:<n>Input: A: pain<n>Answer: Pain is an emotion. It is unacceptable for sporting events to be emotionally driven.<n><n>Input: B: mudslide<n>Answer: Mudslides are weather phenomenon which can cause players to fall off their feet. It is unacceptible for the game to be disrupted<n><n>Input: C: sweating<n>Answer: Sweating happens when people are either too hot or worried<n><n>Input: D: injuries<n>Answer: Injuries are a part of sporting events. Every player has a chance to sustain a minor injury during the course of the game. It is not bad for the game to go on<n><n>Input: E: rain<n>Answer: Rain does not affect the game. Weather will never be the factor that stops a game in progress.<n><n>### Inputs:What happens if we give too much medicine to a patient? Choices:  a: the patient dies b: the patient will heal more quickly c: the patient will be more alert d: the patient's blood pressure will drop<n><n>### Response<n>The correct answer is letter B.<n>### Demostration<n>Input: A: the patient dies<n>Answer: If the patient is given too much medicine, then eventually the patient will stop responding and eventually die.<n><n>Input: b: the patient will be heal more quickly<n>Answer: If they give the patient 2 times more than usual, they are overmedicating the patient. A little bit may actually help, hence the patient will be healed quicker.<n><n>Input: c: the patient will more alert<n>Answer: If the medication is too much, in most circumstances the patient will not have a clear mind until the medicine wears off.<n><n>Input: d: the patient' blood pressure will drop<n>Answer: A patient who has been given too much medicine will start to feel nauseous and then eventually faint. Blood pressure usually falls during fainting.

He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:James's bouncing rubber balls were at rest, and so he could sleep.  He would get up in the morning, and then put them in what state again? Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n><n>### Response:		A: upside down (B) in motion (C) active (D) wakefulness (E) resthold<n><n>#### What is the question asking me to complete? Inputs: A ball in resting state; the ball is resting (upside down): After James wakes up, the rubber ball is in the state it was at resting state.  The ball needs to be restored to the resting state.  So the question is asking: Which of these resting states  the ball can restore to?<n><n>#### Example: Pete is on stage. He has five microphones on his table and then one speaker. When he is talking, the microphones come on but when he is listening, all the microphones are inactive (B) and then (C) active.<n><n>#### Example: The question says to draw the graph of y=3x+2 and then shade the interval (-5,4) What do I have to shade?<n><n>#### What is a demonstration? The graph (B) is active, but the (-5,4) is shaded in. The shaded interval shows us that the shaded values of x, or y, are (negative 5, 4) because they are already at the state they were at the start. <n><n>The question also asks you to write the equation, (which is y=3x+1) and then shade the values.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: 14.  What is the product of 3 and 7. <n><n>### Instructions: 17 is chosen randomly, what is the probability that it is perfect square?<n><n>1) 8<n><n>2) 52%<n><n>### Instructors:How much of the money would need to be used to pay for 100 students who go on a field trip to a museum and 75 students who go swimming?<n><n>1)<n><n>2) 7500<n><n>3) <n><n>### Example 1:<n><n>Input: A student earned 360 points in 2 math classes and 460 points in 3 English classes. With 2 times the many points in Math than in English, and 1.5 times the many points in English than in Math, what is the total points received?<n><n>Output:

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:When I was home, I was comfortable. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:There was a saucepan used only for marinara, where was it kept? Choices:  A: georgia B: the south pole C: kitchen cupboard D: italian restaurant E: boil eggs<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>Input:In a cafeteria, students have unlimited chicken nuggets, unlimited French Fries, and unlimited ice cream. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where is a system of electronic devices likely to be used in school? Choices:  A: nature B: toilet C: computer science D: computer store E: human body<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Answer:A<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>Though a computer can be used as a learning machine and in science, a computer is not as likely to be mentioned during a conversation about electronics. Human science is unlikely to talk about a toilet's electronic components. Therefore, the best choice is (A).<n><n>#### Explanative:<n>Choice (A) is the correct choice.<n><n>### Input:- The sum of positive even integers is a multiple of 14. The sum of the positive odd integers is a multiple of nine. How many positive numbers are there?<n><n>### Response:-<n>#### Answer:- There are 40 such numbers<n><n>#### Explanatory:-<n><n>1. Sum of even integers = 2^n = 2^4 = 16<n><n>2. Sum of odd integers = 3^n = 3^4 = 81<n><n>3. Even multiplier = 2^4= 16<n><n>4.Odd multiple 3^n= 81<n><n>5.Solution<n><n>Total numbers = 2*16+3*81<n>             = 40<n><n>Input:- The sum of positive integers is a multiple of eight. The sum of negative integers is a multiple of seven. How many positive and negative numbers are there?<n>

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What does a chicken do in a joke? Choices:  A: produce eggs B: lay eggs C: become food D: cross road E: looks for cars<n><n>### Response:		A.<n><n>### How:Answer this question according to how you interpret the instruction:<n>Choices include:<n>- A. The correct answer is: A. <n>- B. The correct answer is not: B.<n>- C. The correct answer is also not: C.<n>- D. The correct answer is the following: D.<n>- E. The correct answer is any of these: E.<n><n>### Support:Support your answer by citing evidence from the instruction.<n><n>### Why:Explain why your answer is correct.<n><n>### What:Explain what you’re looking for from this step.<n>

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A projector displayed people on the huge screen while the audience laughed.  What might they be watching? Choices:  A: movies B: theatre C: cabaret D: conference E: meeting<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Inputs: How many members of a group are working on the project? Choices:  A: tide pool B: beach sand C: tidepools D: current E: cooking pot<n><n>### Response:		The answer depends on an answer to the second question. A) The correct answer to the second question is "beach sand" because the crab was scutting, but it strained to move with only beach sand. (The current would be impeding him, but the crab would have to be swimming; therefore B and E are incorrect choices). To answer the third question, we can use any number. It makes no difference.<n><n>### Input for a second question:How many beach sand is one beach sand that one beach sand is one beach?<n><n>### Response for the second question:There is no "beach sand" that makes up one beach sand and one beach sand would be all the beach sand.<n><n>### Ending:The crab was straining in his move because he was carrying all of the beach sand on his shell.<n><n>The Crab was straining in move, because he was carrying all the beach sand on his body.<n><n>### Final Response :<n> <n>### Write a second response that appropriately complements the request.<n>### Input:Billy is running a carnival outside of school. He wants to sell tickets for $1 and use the money to buy pizza. How much pizza can he buy with exactly $400 in tickets?<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response to the question. A response must appropriately complement the request.<n><n># Write a response that appropriates completes the request. If you feel a request is missing something, it is your responsibility to add a response.<n>Write a response to the first question using the code word.<n><n>The request is that you should give the answers as one and the question is as to what is it?<n><n># Write a second response.<n>Write a second response that addresses the other part in the request by giving the answer of all the remaining numbers<n><n># Write a third response to the original request.<n>Write a third response that gives the answer to the original request.

Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		<n>- If it was Cargo ship, the answer would be either 110,000 or 30,000 in terms of containers.<n>- If it was a closet, the answer would be 15.<n>- If it were a port, the answer would be B.<n>- If it is a refrigerator it would be either in Celcius or Fahrenheit depending on the settings. If it was in Celcius, the answer would be between 16 and 20. If it was in Fahrenheit, the answer would be somewhere between 55 and 65.<n>- If the first thing was D, the answer would be C.<n>- If the second and third things are A and E, the answer would be anything but B.<n>- If the fourth and fifth were B and C, the answer would be E.<n><n>

Choices:  A: wear shoes B: learn C: hope for peace D: have a great day. E: do well<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer:  <n><n>Answer:  D<n><n>### Instructor Notes:<n><n>- If the store requires you learn, then only some will know English<n>- The store requires a certain level of English and may exclude you if your level of English is not good<n>- If the store is really busy, people will not be able to learn the language but are still allowed in<n>- The person can hope for peace and be forced out or banned<n>- If they do well, they expect everything to go well and not be stopped or denied entry<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the multiple-choice question. <n><n>### Demand:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>Input: In 2018, there were 108 million cars on U.S roads, a total of 236 million licensed drivers, and 58 million households. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:James was cooking s stew in his apartment kitchen.  Where might he look for a potato. Choices:  A: restaurants B: casserole C: root cellar D: pockets E: pantry<n><n>### Response:		B <n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The sun was out and the temperature changing rapidly, it was really beginning to what? Choices:  A: drop to zero B: increase C: cool down D: dropping quickly E: heat up<n><n>### Response:		<n>In this case “It was” is used here. Hence the answer is A: drop to zero.<n><n>### Input<n>When she was eight years old, Mary decided to start a lemonade stand. Her father helped her to figure out the cost of supplies. He told her that one cup of lemonade would be $.10, the container to drink it in would cost her $2.50, and the cups used to serve the juice came at a price of $1.00 each. Mary wanted to save as much money as possible, so her dad taught her how to order the supplies. He suggested that Mary purchase 12 cups. Why? Because:<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Her father told her to purchase 12 cupps because: it was going to cost her $5.20 and $2.50 to pay for the containers and cups to sell the 12 cups of lemonade then the cups was only costing her $1.20 for 12 cups which means that the cups are going to cost her only $0.10 per cup.<n><n>Then the containers of lemonade was: (2.50)= (1.75)+((13*0.10)) = $2.945<n><n>Which is cheaper then the cups because: 0.10<0.09<n>

Choices:  A: riots B: vote C: change yourself D: social activism E: change clothes<n><n>### Response:		A (riots)  Riots can help change society by making a scene which is hard to ignore. Often times a riot is all it takes  to get the attention of the whole world. Including the leaders of the country. One big riot can make people do what they are told and get the world back on track<n><n>### Input :What do you wish you could change?<n><n>### Response :I wish everyone would just try to smile at least once a day and be more kind to everyone around them. Even if they don't want to spend time with the person next to them. Just maybe one day they will get used to this change and maybe it will become more common. Then maybe the world will  start becoming more friendly.<n><n>### Input 1. You do not need an umbrella.  2. You do not need sunglasses.  3. You do not need a raincoat.  4. You do not need sandals.<n><n>### Response 1. I don't think you need an umbrella because in my opinion the rain isn't much to scared about. It won't hurt your skin and you are likely already used to it. Plus there is no sense in carrying an umbrella if you don't have a chance to use it. 2. You wouldn't really need sunglasses if you had umbrella because then the rain wont be blinding you. 3. I don't really see the need for a raincoat because the rain isn't enough to bother you. 4. I don't see why we need sandals because your feet are probably going to be wet anyway and I don't want water in my shoes while walking in the rainy weather.<n>

Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:If you're afraid of spiders what should you avoid owning?
