How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The gambler had been winning a lot, he wisely decided to what? Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Discussion:<n>### Write a short summary of the questions and answers shown in part E.<n><n>### Part F<n><n>Fill in the blank.  Fill each blank with the appropriate value (A-I) from the numbered choices.<n><n>### Question<n><n>### Input<n>John can make 4 times the amount of muffins on Thursdays than he can make Tuesdays. He can make 228 cups of apple pie on both Saturdays and Sundays. If John made a total of 1640 cupcakes on 8 separate days, how many were muffins?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Demos<n><n>### Problems<n>### Below is an instruction that describe a task.<n>Follow the steps as outlined to find the appropriate response.<n><n>### Step 1<n>Write three multiples of each number from 1 to 7<n><n>### Step<n>Choose 2 of the numbers and multiply them together to form one product.<n><n>### Choice 1<n>\<n>1\*\*\*2<n><n>### Choices 2<n><n>\<n>3\*\*\*4<n><n>### Choose 3<n><n>\<n>5\*\*\*6<n><n>### Step?<n>Repeat step 1 and step 2 as many times as you wish, each with different choices<n><n>Choose one of these steps and complete the multiplication.<n><n>### Input?<n><n>### Summary<n>What does each choice yield when we multiply the three numbers? How does each choice relate to the problem? How do each of the steps apply to the problem?<n><n>### Fill blanks<n>If step? yields 1000, what is 1000 minus the answer to step 2?
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What treatment might an old time doctor have tried to accomplish with leeches? If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A person writes a check to a clerk, where does the clerk put them? Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		<n>I chose that love is D: painful. It's said that love is blind, but I love my dog, she can't see, is deaf and blind. It is unfortunate, but that didn't change my love for her. I knew she can't see so I started to use sign language to teach her words or actions. In the long run she was better than most guide dogs I know. She sleeps with her head on my lap, she doesn't like to be woke up without a good reason like if someone came in the house.<n>But I also know that she loves me more than some people I know. I do believe that true love is being blind and not knowing it. I also think true love is painful and hurtful. But you can't explain the feelings and emotions true love brings out of you. I once did love someone, I had to break it off. The pain was not pleasant, but it was a good experience for me because I'm better now. It made me realize how I can't allow anyone to manipulate me or be in control, but I did learn to control my fear, anxiety, hurt and sadness. Love is contagious, but the pain is not when you no longer love the person anymore. Even though I lost this one love, I know I'm stronger for it.<n>### Input:You can tell where a person is from by the clothes they wear, what color their shirt is, it's their style, and the car they drive. "I totally agree."<n><n>### Response:"My favorite band is Queen"<n><n>```python<n>def isQueen(name):<n>  print("is queen")<n>if name=="Queen":<n>  return True<n>else:<n>  print("not a queen")<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:This subtask has multiple choice questions. Choose two answers.<n><n>### Examples:(1)<n><n>### Demos:(1)<n><n>```python<n>a=""<n>for c in ["b","c"]:<n>  a+=c<n>print(a)<n>```<n><n>```python<n>b=""<n>for c in ['a','c']:<n>  b+=c<n>print(b)<n>```<n><n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What would you normally expect a cat to say? Choices:  A: see king B: hello C: meow D: drink water E: live many years<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you give that cat some milk, it will meow.<n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where will a native lemur be found? Complete the two sentences with the two new words you learned.<n>First of all, I didn't like ____  ___  ___  ____.<n>For second, I didn't think your idea would  work.<n><n>Answer: First of all, I didn’t like the idea and second, I didn’t think (the idea) would work.<n><n>### Input<n><n>My favorite class is PE because I love  outdoor.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input, Demonstration and Instructions<n>Say what you understand the above sentence to mean. How well did you do?<n><n>My favorite class (is/are) PE because I love outdoor.<n><n><n>### Demand and Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Answer:<n>There will be 90 questions with five answer choices each, each worth one point (for a total of 450 points).<n><n>### Input for task 3<n><n>#### Demonstration: Input:<n>You will see the answers to eight questions (see below). You will not be penalized for incorrect answers here.<n><n>**How many of the following questions below do you want an answer to?**<n><n>**A**: 1<n><n>**B**: 4<n><n>**C**: 3<n><n>**Select all the letters that apply.**<n><n>**D**: 5<n><n>#### Demonsteration<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Input Demo<n><n>#### Input 1<n><n>#### Input 2<n><n>#### Input 3<n><n>#### Input 4<n><n>#### Input 5<n><n>### Demeter<n><n>### Input 6<n><n>#### Instructions<n><n>**Input:** The following question contains two incomplete <n>sentences. Complete the two  sentences with the two new <n>words you learned.<n><n><n>**First of all, I  love  ___ ___.**<n><n>**For second, I didn’ t think that  ___  would  ___.  ___  ___.**<n><n>### Answer<n><n>First of all, love outdoor. For second, didn’ t think your idea would work.<n><n>

Choices:  A: idaho B: casserole C: new hampshire D: root cellar E: ireland<n><n>### Response:		Answer A.<n><n>### Input:`<n><n>### Response:`<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input`The average of an array of numbers with a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 10 can be calculated using this simple equation. a[i] = a[1] + a[2] +... + a[i-1]<n><n>### Instructions:For a given number of items, what is the size of the array?<n><n>### Input:-13<n><n>### Response:-1 3<n><n>### Instructions:How would you represent the size of the array given the response and using the formula above?<n>### Input:-3 1 6<n><n>### Response_A_1_6:-1 4<n><n>### Input_11:<n><n>### Response`<n><n>### Input```a[4] = a[3]*1.4<n><n>### Response```a[4] + a[1]<n><n>## 3-12<n>Input: Janet<n>Jennie 100 + 100 Jen16<n>Glen 110 + 5 Jen49<n><n>Input: Jennie<n>Jennie 33 %- 10 10 Jen13<n>Glen 100 + Gl100 Jen100<n><n>Input: Glen<n>Glen 15 %- 10 Jen15<n><n>Input<n>Janet 211 Jen12<n><n>Input: Jen16<n>Gl100 + Jen100 Jen13<n><n>Input: Glen100<n>Gl105 + Jen13 5<n><n>Input: Jenn15<n>Jennie 27 Jen 3<n><n>Input: Jenn49<n>Glen 14 and Jen14 Jen28<n><n>Input: Jenn9<n>Glen 21 Jen11<n><n>Input<n>Gl5 Jen11<n><n><n>Input: Glen5<n>Glen 5 Jen9<n><n>Input: Jen9<n>Jennie 52 Jen 9<n><n>Input<n>150 Jen26

If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Option A**<n><n>A: regret<n><n>#### Explanation<n>When someone is inebriated, he/she will probably regret what he/she has uttered out later.<n><n>### Input<n>A: What is likely to happen to a speaker after becoming inebriat<n><n>B: What is likely to<n><n>C: What is l<n><n>D: What is l<n>####Explanation<n>The only thing that is relevant is the text in the first line which says " A: What is likely to..". We can't be sure what the question was. There was no prompt, "What is likely..." which we can use to identify the last part of the question.<n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Why is this person not listening to music? Choices:  A: fall asleep B: relaxation C: deafness D: bored E: calm<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Instructions:Their choices are: The number of people who have gotten COVID-19 so far. At least 9 billion: At least 30,000: The total number of people who have died so far. At least one million: The total number of babies that have been born. Around one million, so less than 9,999,999: ___<n><n>### Output: The answer is choice D, at least nine billion people.<n><n>### Solution:<n>**D.** We know at least 9 billion have gotten COVID-9. The minimum is 9,000,000, thus 9,001 is at least 9,009,999.<n><n>### Input (D2): What is the relationship between a and b?<n><n>### Solution (D2):<n>**A**. a and b are positive integers<n><n>### Input and output:<n><n>### Input<n>Input: A,B, and C are different letters.<n><n>### Output<n>The answer is that AB is not a permutation of C<n><n>### Problem<n><n>### Input - Letters are A,B,C, but A can be 1 or 2 or any integer. B can be 1 or any integer and C can be any positive integer<n><n>### Output - AB is not a permutations of C<n>### Solution - Choice B. A permute of C.

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		<n>C. winning or losing<n><n>### Demonication:<n>Input: The new version of a popular game console costs $450.  By comparison, the previous model costs $280.  How much more does it cost from one to the next?<n>Answer:  $170<n><n>Input: 500 tanks will carry troops and supplies for a 25 mile journey.  Each tank carries 10 troops and 1500 pounds of supplies.  How many troops will travel across the river in each tank?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input : 100 women are dancing in a circle without stepping on the same spot twice. How many dancers are there?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: At three o'clock in the morning, a plane's speed is 80% of its speed at twelve o'clock in the daytime. That is, the plane's speed doubles when the sun rises.  How many miles per minute does the plane fly at three o'clock in morning versus twelve o'clock in daytime?<n>Answer: half<n><n>Input: There are 800 workers. Each worker does 24/70 as much work as there are people. How many workers are there in the workplace?<n>Answer: 75<n><n>Input: 3 times 7 is 21. If you add 100 to the 3 times 7, you get 52. What do the 3 x 7 and 100 x 7 have in common?<n>Answer: they are divisible by 7<n><n>### Demonycations:<n>Input: For every person in the audience there are two tickets available. Each ticket has a letter printed on it. The numbers on each letter range from 20 to 100. For every hundred tickets there are 10000 dollars going to a charity of the winner's choice.<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Demonsications:<n>Input: There are two bags of identical apples. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. Choices:  A: mobile phone B: wristwatch C: briefcase D: office E: desktop<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is "C wristwatch"<n><n>You may want to have the choice to include or do not include any input so that the student can see the choice available and have a sense of which way is correct if they need it. I think it is also good to make sure the answer options are not so confusing that it would not be clear to the general student at the lower end of the SIFT range. Idea: The choice between "A" and "B" may be difficult for someone, but once they see both the answer and choice, they will then know that they must include all the inputs.<n><n>#### Student Example Input<n><n>The students who take this quiz can all get partial credit on any question that is answered incorrectly. For example on question 1:<n><n>A. Answers: 26, 27 or 28<n>B. Answers: 11, 27 or<n>C. Answers: 40, 35 or 33<n><n>I would argue that in this scenario, even if they do get a partial credit on any question, that is still counting as "correct" because it is answering the question "correctly" by providing either an answer option or leaving the question blank. I think it is fair to make the option they choose to get credit be an answer option (like #20), or to simply have them leave the question blank (like # 21).<n><n>### Response #1(Correct): Janet has 9 more cards than Brenda. Mar has 10 more cards. how many cards do they all add up to?<n><n>### Response 2(Incorrect): Janet has 10 more than Brenda. Marea has 10 more. The sum is 30 more. How many cards do the add up to?<n>```<n><n>#### Answer 1:<n>You are right about the difference between the two correct options.<n><n>#### Answer 2:<n>This answer is incorrect because even though the students get partial credit for answering the question, the answer still counts as "correct" because the students get points for the question, and only "incorrect" answers will not count.<n><n>### Student Example: The person wearing the pinstripe shirt had the most, since there were five of them and pinstripes. It isn't right because:<n>We are told that

Your response must include supporting evidence.<n><n>### Below are words that represent important concepts. Write a response that applies the concept from the word to a word on the left (example: use "increase" in the response that describes the concept "addition").<n><n>### Responses:<n>Words: Example words (concepts): 1, 0, 11, 15, 6, half, 3/5, half, three times, 3, half, 10, and half.  In an experiment with 30 students, 8 students increased their math scores, 16 students decreased their math scores, and 6 students continued to do the same math scores the year before. In total, there were 2 fewer students doing better in math scores than last year. If 15 students also increased at least half of their previous grades, what is the average math score now?<n><n>answer: (15 * 1/2 + 6) / 30 = 10.5<n><n><n>

The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What feeling might propel one to instituting civil action? Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		<n>If it was done during court or a lawsuit, then it may be anger. Or maybe it was because of a complication that the one has encountered.<n><n>### Input 2:Who would not be able to walk on water, an elephant, a bird, a butterfly? If his salary amounts to $22,247, how much money does Natalie's mother receive?<n><n>### Demostration:Sarah has two and 1/4 times as many brothers as sisters.  She also has 6 times as many sisters as her brother <n>has. How many brothers does Sarah have?<n><n>### Input:(1/3) of 8 equals<n><n>### Demestraton: (1/1) 8 = 8<n><n>### Demestration: (1/3) 6 = 2<n><n>### Input :(1/2) 6 + 4<n><n>### Demstration:<n>(1/2)6 + 4 =??<n><n>6 / (2) = 2 + 4<n><n>6 / 6 = 8 / 4 = 8 + 4 = 8 – 4 = 4<n><n>## Instructions:Fill in the blank.<n><n>### The _______ value of a _______ is its _______ to a _______ on the same _______.<n><n><n>### Instutions:<n>### Instrucitons:Fill in the blanks for the following math question.<n><n>## Subtraction:<n>Subtraction is the opposite of addition:<n>### The basic principles:<n><n>### Multiplication and division:<n>Multiplication and division are operations that can be done to a quantity. You start by using x for multiplication, and / for division. It is a shortcut notation. <n><n>### Addition and Subtraction:<n><n>### Negative Numbers:<n>Negative numbers have a different meaning than positive numbers. <n><n>**Example:**<n><n>5+(-1) – 5 = 5+1 = 6<n><n>In basic math, you generally start your number line with zero at the top, which indicates no number. A large number like 6 will generally go down. A small negative number, less than zero like -6; will go up.<n><n># Operations<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The department store is located in the Northwest USA.  Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		 D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### You will work with a partner.<n>### Use the instructions to complete the response.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>*Drew is doing a research paper on hurricane Katrina. Which of the following information can Drew find in his library’s online catalog that will help him start? <n>  * A: date it happened<n>  * B: location of 2005 event<n>  * C: causes of 2003 storm in the Caribbean<n><n>### Instructor:<n>*Drew does not write her research paper in the first person point of view. Write that sentence on your paper and then check your answer with your partner.<n><n>*Drew needs to write his research paper using the library’s online catalog system. Describe in writing for your instructor what kind of information you can type into the catalog to help you quickly get started on your research. Then, check your answer with your group.<n>    * D: name of book<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>### Read the text below.<n><n>The students are watching a movie about a pirate. What is one of the many things he has to watch them doing? Choices:  A: bathe B: bite C: die of cancer D: obesity E: copulate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- [A,B,C,D,E are wrong. Animals don't bathe because they have waterproof fur or scales so they wouldn't need to. They don't usually die of cancer if you are giving them the right treatment. Animals can't get obese because they already have a perfect body type. Copulation occurs in some animals but they can copulate with other species if they mate with many partners.<n><n>![alt text](./.gitignore/assets/A.png)<n>![alt text](./assets/B.png)<n>![Alt text](./assets/C.png)<n>![![alt text](./](./assets/D.png)<n>![image by jacob o on unsplash](./assets/E.png)<n><n>[![](./assets/F.png)](./assets/G.png)<n><n>![(Image by [Christian Spencer](https://unsplash.com/@christianspencer?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText)](./assets/H.png))]<n>![Photo by [Fabian Brännsten](https://unsplashed.com/photos/G0y55QdWLy1)](./assets/I.png)]<n><n>[![](https://www.krystalbiotech.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Biocon-1.jpg)](./assets/K.png)<n>![Photo by [Christina Morillo](https://unsplasm.com/photoswip/7164228/)](./assets/L.png)<n>![][Image from Pixabay](./assets/M.png)<n>![Image by [Jen Theodore](https://unsplath.com/photosets/1097458))](./assets/N.png)<n>![Picture by [Alvin](https://www.pexels.com/photo/little-animal-kitty-sleeping-baby-kitty-1166721/)](./assets/O.jpg)<n>![By [Ella Olsson](https://unspls.com/photoset/94

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. Choices:  A: new experiences B: playfulness C: own house D: good looking E: beautiful<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>---<n><n>This challenge is based on the following question: How many cards do they [Janet and Mara] have in all if Mar a has 40 cards left than 150 [150 - 40 = 110]? Let's say the cards are red cards and the cards have 4 values (card numbers).<n><n>The first question we should resolve:<n><n>Red cards. If Janet has 9 more compared to Brenda, which is Janet's value is 9 more than Brenda's value (for example 5, 14, 41, 80, 129... or 5, 24,69, 114...).<n><n>How many cards have?<n>5,555,669 cards<n><n>Janet has 9 cards (more compared to Brenda) which is 9 places between the 2 numbers: 129 - 120 which is 65 [65x9=585].<n><n>So if we add them:<n><n>Janet's value [24] + 65 cards = 90<n><n>Mara's value [41] + 65 + 10 + 10 [brenda cards] = 96<n><n>This is how they have cards:<n><n>Janet 90<n>Mara 96<n><n>The 4th question we should resolve: The question says: How many cards do he [Pete] walk?<n><n>The answer is 57 which is 53 blocks + 4 blocks.<n><n>The 5th question we should resolve : How many blocks did PETE?<n><n>The answer, like I said earlier, PETE walks 53 blocks then he goes by bus to the post office to grab 20 cards which means his bus goes 23 blocks (57 blocks for PETE, 23 for bus) that leaves 34 blocks for PETE.<n><n>This is how many blocks PETE traveled: 53 + 23 + 34 [from the previous answer] = 110<n><n>The 6th question we should go through:<n><n>How many chairs are there?<n><n>Let's start form the right

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		Where does a human expect to find  manufacturing operations? <n><n>* B<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Solutions<n>Input: Janet had 9 cards more than brenda. Mara had twice as many cards as Jane. How many cards did they have in all if Marina had 40 cards less.<n>A) 211<n>B) 135<n>C) 64<n>D) 145<n>E) 61<n><n>Answer:<n><n>From the second passage we know that Marina had 40 less cards than the total for both Janet/Brenda and Mara. Adding Brenda's and Mara's number of cards gives us 170+90+ the 40 Janet had and that equals 260, so Marina had 40 more cards than the total number of people had.<n><n>Input: Pert walked 5 blocks from the house to the bus garagae in TX and rode the bus 21 blocks to the post office. Later he came back the same way. How did Pert travel in all?<n><n>A) 75<n>B) 50<n>C) 5 blocks<n>D) 56<n><n>Answer: The answer that best fits the input would be A, as 5 blocks and 5 blocks equals 10 blocks in total.<n><n>Input: In the class, there are blue chacirs, green chairs and white chairs. The blue chairs are 3x the number of green chairs and is 13 fewer white than combinded green and blue chairs. How many chairs were there in the class?<n><n>A)  26<n>B) 105<n>C) 123<n>D) 272<n>E) 580<n><n>Answer:The answer that best fits this input is A, because the question indicates that there are more green chairs than there are blue chairs but also fewer white chairs than that, which combined equals 13 less than all the green and blue chaires together.<n><n>Input: A Bird eats 7 berrys per day. Samuel has 129 birds. How many berrys do Samuel's birds together eat is 4 days?<n><n>A)    172<n>B

The sun has the effect that during the day and night the Earth gets hot and cold.<n><n>### Question:How is Earth's motion around the sun the cause of the seasons?<n><n>### Response A:During the spring, summer, fall, and winter, the Earth changes position in relation to the sun.<n><n>Response B: While it's farther from the Sun in Winter, it is further away in Summer due to the tilt of the Earth's axis.<n><n>### Response C: At different times of the year, the Northern and Southern Hemispheres tilt in different directions, blocking some sunlight.<n><n>### Choice D: Some seasons last longer than others<n><n>### Response E: As the distance between the Earth and the Sun varies, the Earth's climate also does.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Would a volunteer   do this?  Chose  A:  go home, B:  volunteer, C:  stay in after-care<n>D: go to work  E: no<n><n>## The input will be a mathematical expression. The input will be made up of symbols from the set S. The output should  be a  mathematical expression using the set of symbols from S. Each of the letters from S will have a possible score. The possible scores for each letter include (but may not be limited to) the numbers zero, 1, 2, 3, four, and 5. The scores may not be zero (0) or 1. The first and second letters must have both the same and different scores. The other letters may or may not have the same score as a previous letter and are not required to.<n><n>### Input S: the empty set, the set {a, b}, the set {a,c}, the set {a}<n><n>Answer:<n>### 563:<n><n>### S: {a, b}, 5<n><n>### Input :<n><n>Letters: a: 5<n><n>## E:<n><n>### Input letters:<n><n>Letters a: 5<n>### Output E:<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:If a person wants to buy a radio, where are they likely to go? Choices:  A: station B: every car and house C: shop D: bedroom E: space shuttle<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following open-ended questions.<n><n>### Question: Where are you most likely to see people using a radio?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Demand:What do you feel is the most likely choice that could be used to answer the previous question? Be sure to explain why the answer is the correct one.<n><n>### Answer1:<n><n>### Answer2:<n><n>### Question2:What is the most likely reason for the incorrect answer being chosen?<n><n>### Democracynow:Who would you have chosen? Why?<n><n>### Revised Code:<n><n>### Input<n>```plain<n>Question:If a person wants …<n>```<n>### Demand<n>```plain<n>Answer:<n>```<n>### Answer1<n>```plain<n>Answer1:<n>```<n>## Revised Code<n>```plain<n>input:<n>```plain<n>Question1:Where is …<n>```plain<n>demand:<n>```plain<n>Answer2:<n>```plain<n>response:<n>```plain<n>input1:<n>```plain<n>where are you most likely to ….<n>```plain<n>democraticnow:<n>```plain<n>who would you have chosen? why?<n>```<n>### Revised Output<n><n>### Original Output<n>Question:If a Person wants to buy a radio then they are most likely to go to the shop.<n>Demand:What is the most correct answer that could be given to our first question?<n>Answer1: Station<n>Democraticnow:Who would you have given the answer and why?<n>Demand2:What is the reason that the person would have chosen a wrong answer?<n><n>### Output Revised<n>Question:Where are you most likely to go to buy a radio? Choose the best answer.<n>Choices:  A: Station  B: Car  C: House  D: Both  E: Bedroom<n>Answer: C<n>Demand:Why is the answer A C?<n>Answer2: The answer is C because that is the most plausible answer.<n>Democratic Now:Who do we usually see using radios?<n>Demand: Why did you choose your answer?<n><n>[1]: https://github.com/sindresorhus/to-number<n>[2]: https://github.codeburst.io/<n>[3]: https://codepen-
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		C - Intelligence<n><n>C<n><n>### Input:-6 times 7 plus 9 minus 5 equals?<n><n>### Response:-39<n><n>-4 times 8 minus 4 equals?<n><n>## Output<n><n>**Answer** - **Output**<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the following calculations.<n><n>### Input<n><n>07, 22, -12, -3, 0, -5, 2<n><n>### Response - Input<n><n>722 - 12 - 2 = -19<n><n># - # # - #<n><n>### Input :32 49 -23 + 87% <n><n>### Response  :79-23+ 796=1012 <n>

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she just woke up? Choices:  A: drink tea B: thank god C: open eyes D: feel angry E: complete sentence<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C<n>

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What are people playing when they want to take the lead with small papers? Choices:  A: very heavy B: video game C: news article D: card game E: lead pencil<n><n>### Response:		Answer "E". The leading pencil is a thin lead pencil and leads, and so it is written, that it is not very heavy, nor is it video game, news article, or card games. So, pencil is the correct answer.<n><n>### Input<n>How many people were not there, if 199 people were at the picnic, and 58 children were present?<n><n>### Response<n>Answer "69". 199-58 is 141. 141-69 gives you 72. 72/2=36. 72-36 are 38, and 38/3 are 13. Finally, 35-13 is giving you 22. 22/3 are 7, and 7+6 is 13. 13+2 is 15. 15 divided by 2 is 7. 7 times 3 is 21. 21 is an integer.<n><n>### How many people are there in 55, if 55 is an answer, and 19 is a question?<n><n>### Demostration:Answer "53". Because each square of 9 has double the space, there are two units of 5 and one unit of 4 in a unit of 9 squares. Also, each unit of 5 has one unit of 4 on top, two units of 3 on two sides, and one unit of 5 on the bottom. This means we have 6 squares of 3 with 4 squares on top, 5 squares of 3 on two ends, and one square of 4 in the middle. Then, all these units together give us 6 units of 3 and 1 unit of 9, showing that the answer is actually 53.<n><n><n>

There are 74 fewer hens than total number eggs. If there are 6 hens left and 424 eggs left, how many hens and eggs are in the country?<n>**Answer:** 16 hens and 282 eggs<n>**Input:** There are 66 students at a school, out of which 14 are girls, and 50 are boys. How many boys go to school?<n>**Input: **In a school where there are 98 students and the boys account for almost half of them, there are 81 boys. If the number of girls is less than than number of boys by one, how many girls are there in the school?<n>**Input**: There are 244 students at a school, 154 of them are girls. 48 of them are boys. If the number boys is less than twice the number of girls by 7, how many girls are at the school?<n>**Answer**: There are 47 students in the library. In the rest of the school building, there are 4 fewer girls than boys. The number of boys is less than 16 times the number of girls by two if there are 20% more girls than boys. As many as 9 more boys than girls are at the school.<n>How many girls are at the rest of the schoolbuilding?<n>**Answer: 43<n><n>**Input: **Ten times as many children live in rural schools as urban schools in India. 9 students of the 555 that live in rural schools are girls. Out of the 90 who live in urban schools, 4

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Dave put his beer where he could get to it, but it would be off the floor. Humans have the ability to talk, however if a person was getting ready to go to sleep you wouldn't expect that person to be talking. The only choice that makes sense is relaxation. The other choices are incorrect.<n>

The function should follow its instructions to travel to the destination point on the map. If it cannot find the destination then it should print an error message.<n><n>```js<n>const followThrough = function(instructions, map, currentLocation){<n>	if(instructions.length == 0){<n>		return;<n>	}<n><n>	instructions.push({destination:currentLocation})<n><n>	const direction = instructions[0]<n><n>	if(direction == undefined || direction.destination == undefined){<n>		return false;<n>	}<n>	let destination 	= directions[0];<n>	let previousLocation = currentLocation<n><n>	let distance	= map[direction.destination];<n><n>	if(prevLocation

Choices:  A: down a river B: city C: repair shop D: parking lot E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		Answer D<n><n>### Input:(150 ml/min) x (10 ml) =<n><n>### Response:(1500 ml/min)*(2 ml/min)*1.3 kg,<n><n>15000(2m*9.8)m =4 km<n><n>### Input (95, 70, 67, 26.2) + (101, 112, 69, 33) + (86, 126, 75, 33.2)+ (87, 63, 67, X). This is known as a "subtraction meme."<n><n>### Response  (26,1,5,0)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:To gain her trust the real estate agent was very polite, delightful and all around what? Choices:  A: manipulate B: charming C: deceive D: exaggerate E: incompetent<n><n>### Response:		Answer: manipulate (a)<n><n>### Input : The boy's bike had 20 inches of height and a 9-tube frame. He also added 10 more inches to the height for a total of 30 inches and a 19-tube frame, was this addition of inches enough to qualify the bike as a tricycle? Choices:  a): not enough b): yes c): not even close enough d): a definite no e): a maybe<n><n>### Response : Answer: no (e)<n>

Choices: A : 15 B : 18 C: 20 D : 21 E: 24 <n><n>### Response : C <n>```<n>Answer: 20<n>```<n>`<n><p>The first response is C (20). The first hint tells me there are 2 classes with 10 students each. </p><n><p>The second response is A (15).</p><n><n>### Input:- 5 pounds of flour produces 4 loaves of bread, how many times as much flour can produce 30 loaves of bread? Choices: A B C D E<n>### Response: A<n>```<n>Answer: A<n>```<n>`<n>```<n>The first is 2 pound of flour produce 1 loaf<n>The second is 5 pound of flour produces 1 loaf<n>5/2 = 2.5, then 2.5 times 5 will produce 13 loaves of bread<n>```<n>`<n>

Choices:  A: employment B: frustration C: stress D: working hard E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n>A - employment<n><n>### Input:(1-10) (1-10)<n>(3,9) <n>(3,8) <n>(3,-1) <n>(3-2)<n><n>### Response:(1-10), what number will be 1-1, 1-2, 1-3,...<n><n>### Solution:<n>For number 3 - 9<n><n>9 + 9 * ( 1/0 ) = 3 + ( -1 )<n><n>11 == 3 <n><n>For number 3-2<n><n>2 + ( -1 ) * ( 1/2 ) = 2 + ( -1/2 )<n><n>3 == 3<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input:-0.5 + 0.5 + √3 + √4 +...<n><n>### Solution:(2)-.5<n><n>### Demotstration:<n><n>## Solution<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Test<n><n>### Input - Answer<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Why would I want to be exercising? Choices:  A: fatigue B: relaxation C: tiredness D: muscle weakness E: losing weight<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A is the only one that would benefit from exercise<n><n>### Input and response:How can I tell my parents to stop using the television so much? Choices: 1: tell them we don't have any electricity. 2: tell the electric company to cut it off. 3: say they are so noisy and distracting. 4: take the batteries out of the clock radio. 5: turn off our electric meter because it needs to be cleaned<n><n>### Inputs:The time for the train to leave was 2:10. The train left at 2:08. Choices:  A: dry hair B: spreading C: blowing hard D: change direction E: wave wheat<n><n>### Response:		<n>I can use the number line modeling to complete the equation.<n><n>$$(3\times3/2)=8$$<n><n>### Input1:In Texas, a gallon of gas costs \$3.29. In Louisiana, gas costs \$1.95/gallon. How much cheaper is gas in Texas?<n><n>### Response1:<n>I can write $3.29-1.95=1.34$.<n><n>### Input2:In a classroom, 25 children take a math quiz. If you add all the scores, what is the answer?<n><n>###  Response2:<n>Addition, $2.351$.<n><n>### I can use the strategy of breaking the problem into a series of equations<n><n>### Subtracting two integers is not allowed<n><n>### In the question, I need to add fractions<n><n>### I need to multiply two or more integers, but that operation is not allowed<n><n><n>### The task is in a different problem domain than my skill set<n><n>### Task instructions are incomplete or incorrect<n><n>### I do not know the required operation for an unknown question<n><n>### The problem has one or more unknown operations<n><n>### The question requires an operation, but the answer does not<n><n>### I am required to perform something other than adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing<n><n>### I cannot apply problem-solving strategies to a word problem<n><n>### Problems require unknown information<n><n>### I have to apply one or more specialized operations other than arithmetic operations like division, square roots<n><n>### A question demands a more complex operation like the power of 10 or addition of fractions<n><n>## How to respond:<n>* What resources helped you solve this problem, if any? <n>* What resources,

Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		In a room with a dirty or smelly place, one should check the source of the smelly smell.<n><n><n>### Input :<n><n>Damien and Fletcher are looking for the source of a smell emanating from their classroom. Damien believes the source is the garbage can that is under a table in the room. The garbage can under the table holds three trash bags (two of each type) of garbage that are all filled up all the way. Damien notices that there is garbage in the garbage can that looks like it was not put in there by any of the teachers (for example, it did not look like an apple core). Fletcher says that Damien should check under the table where the garbage can has been placed. <n><n>```<n>DAMIEN: The smell is coming from HERE!<n>```<n><n>Fletcher, instead, says:<n><n>```<n>FLETCHER: The smell might not originate in a garbage can that is under the first table.<n>```<n><n>Furthermore, Fletcher suggests that Damien check under the top table that is in the room. Then, Fletcher says he will check if there is other smell besides Damien's. <n><n>``` <n>FLETCHE: Maybe the garbage can that is in front of us isn't the source of the smells either!<n>```<n><n>Then Fletcher suggests Damien check under the table that is in front of them. If Damien does not agree to that, they will check somewhere else. <n><n>

Choices:  A: crash B: living C: slow down D: carry people E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Input : At a picnic, 40 people had fruit punch, 30 people had tea, and 20 people had both fruit punch and tea.  How many people were there altogether at the picnic if each person could have had one or more drinks?<n><n>### Response : C<n><n>### Input  : Four more than 3x - 2. How many pizza do you have?<n><n>### Solution: B<n><n>### Input   : Panda hides in the tree for 34 days. Every 3 days, he breaks off a bough and eats it. How long will it take for Panda to eat the entire tree?<n><n>### Input<n>: At Danny's restaurant, there are 14 guests. If 6 guests order a large pizza and 14 guests order a small pizza, how many pizzas must Danny make to feed everyone?<n><n>### Instutcion: Which of the following numbers is the greatest? 24/49<n><n>### Solution :C<n><n>### Instrucion : On Monday, David made 1/3 of his homework. On Tuesday, he made 1/6 of the homework he had left. On Monday, David had 24 pieces left, but by Tuesday he had cut his homework in half. By how much had David cut his homework on Monday?<n><n>### Answer : 6<n><n>#### Answer all questions in correct column for each subtraction number with no more than one error:<n>|Number to substract|24|54|62|82|102|132|28|52<n><n>|Correct answer to substracts?|C|F|C|G|H|G|D|B<n><n>### Instrutcion: What is 9 minus 7?<n><n>### Solustion: B<n><n>## 1.8. 10 Questions<n><n>### Answer all the questions correctly using the numbers given which are shown in blue.<n><n>### Number of Questions in subtractions<n><n>|Numbers in subtractions|0 to 5|5 |6<n><n>### Answer given to subtractions<n><n>### Answer to substract:<n><n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a binder? What time on Wednesdays does the company start to work?<n><n>### Response<n>The company starts to work at 8am.<n><n>### 25<n>### Demonstraction<n><n>Input: A book costs $7. How much more would it cost if you buy it?<n>Answer: $14<n><n>	<n>### Instruction<n><n>	<n>## Instructions:Write a short, grammatically correct, readable, and meaningful reply. (5 sentences minimum)<n><n>### Input<n><n>Josine needs to read a book and has 8 options to choose from:<n>	The Great Gatsby<n>	Wuthering Heights<n>	Anne of Green Gables<n>	The Lord of the Rings<n>	Moby Dick<n>	The Count of Monte Cristo<n>	Les Misérables<n>	The Da Vinci Code<n>	Answer The Call of the Wild<n>Of these, which one is the least expensive?<n>(Assume there are no discounts, and all books are the same edition.)<n><n><n>### Response A<n><n>Josine should read The Great Gatsby because it is cheapest in the market.<n><n>### Response B<n><n>Although all other books are priced equally, I would advise Josine to read The Great Gatsbys because she would be able to finish the book in the shortest period of time.<n><n>### Note for Staff<n><n>This task is provided as an example. Modify it to meet the objective.<n><n>### Addendum 1<n><n>If you do not think it is possible, use this reply:<n><n>The answer to your question is A, because ________________________<n><n>### Addend<n><n>Do not answer the question in your write up. Please refer to our addendum on addended instructions.<n>
