Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The problem of civil action is resolved by law enforcement and the judge. Civil action is an act of court involving a case in which a party brings a claim against another in any jurisdiction to ask a court to prevent a party from doing an action that is allegedly forbidden by law, or to compel a party to take an action that is alleged to be required by law.<n><n>### Input<n>Ask for a word that rhymes with carrot.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The word that rhymes is barrot and squat.<n><n>### Output<n>Ask for a letter not in the word cat.<n><n>### Expected Output<n>Letters can be used to form words, so the letter "a" cannot be in the word cat. If it is equal to the last input of the second part, that means that the prime condition was met`)<n>`for i in range(48):<n>    a = int(input("Input a value: "))<n>

The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides.  What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? Choices:  A: state park B: opera C: disneyland D: carnival E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n>(Enter response here.)<n><n>### Input 2:<n>People also celebrate by attending carnivals and amusement parks.<n><n>### Response 2:<n>(Enter response 2 here.)<n><n>## #3<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Write a question that demonstrates the task from the above exercise.<n><n>---<n><n>### Input question:<n>What is the number that is 68% of 1/2?<n><n>---<n><n>[Back to index](https://github.com/marshallh/TASK)

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:What will happen if you are successful when committing suicide? Choices:  A: scars B: being born C: sorrow D: misery E: kill yourself<n><n>### Response:		C: sorrory<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1)<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/Python<n><n># 9.1: Input/Output of multiple choice questions<n><n>i=1<n>while i <= 100<n>    print("Input: {}".format(i))<n>    i=i+2<n>print("")<n>```<n><n>**Code**:<n>```python<n>i=1<n>#while i <= 15<n>while i<= 100<n>        print("Input: {} ".format(i))<n>        i=i+2 #i=i+2 will increment the value of the variable i 2 times.<n>    #i+=2 #will increment the value of the n by 4<n>print("")<n><n>```<n><n>**Output**:<n><n>```python<n>Input: 1<n>Input: 2<n>Input: 3<n>Input: 4<n>Input: 5<n>Input: 6<n>Input: 7<n>Input: 8<n>Input: 9<n>Input: 10<n>Input: 11<n>Input: 12<n>...<n>...<n>Input: 97<n>Input: 98<n>Input: 199<n><n>```<n><n><n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A school is most likely to be located in what sort of zone? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: community C: building D: prague E: every city<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is true but E is false.<n><n>### Input:(1) the average age of 3 men and 2 women is 30<n>(2) the average age of the same group of 5 people is 31<n><n> (3) the average age of all 3 men plus the average age of all the women (whether singly or jointly) is 31.<n><n>### Response:(1) 22<n> <n>### Instruction:(1) The average height of students is 5 feet 9 inches. <n>(2) The average height of women is 5 feet 2 inches. <n>(3) The average height of girls is 5 feet 3 inches. <n>(4) The average height of men is 5 feet 12 inches.<n>(5) The average height of boys is 5 feet 4 inches.<n><n>### Answer:(1) 5 (((5'9 + 5'12) / 2) - (5'3 + 5'4))<n><n>### Input:[A woman and a horse travel together at 50 miles per hour for 2 hours]. (1) The horse is traveling at a slower pace than the woman.<n>(2) The horse is travelig at twice the pace the woman is.<n><n>### Output:(1) The woman is traveling at a pace faster than the horse.<n><n>### Source: https://math.rice.edu/~lanius/courses/ma211/12/ma211_problems_12.pdf

Choices:A: apologize for making them feel uncomfortable, even if they haven’t said anythingB: ask how they’re doingC: try and understand their perspectiveD: give them time to think of something to sayE: ask them a leading question<n><n>### Response;E<n><n>### Instructor: The correct response to a question is:<n><n>### Answer: D<n><n>* Instructor<n>* Choices<n>* C<n>* B<n><n><n>### The correct response to a request is:<n><n>## Instructor has provided 5 pieces of information. Match each piece of information to its correct question.<n><n>* Janet has 9<n><n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct response to a question answer A.<n>The correct response to an instruction is answer C.<n><n>### Input a request<n><n>### Instucor is the answer.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Question<n><n>* The correct response to a quesntion is answer D B or E or A<n>* A<n>* C or A or B or D<n><n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n><n>### Response:		F:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Input 2：<n><n>### The task<n><n>### Input : Write a sentence and fill in the blank with one of the following:  - the most important part of a _____ statement - a special kind of _____ statement - a blank in a _____ statement<n><n>### Response : Choose the answer that best completes the sentence.<n><n>### A) a declarative sentence<n><n>### B) a statement<n><n>### C) a statement that makes a request<n><n>### D) a special kind of statement<n><n>### E) the most important part of request statement<n><n>### Input：One day, Jake found something special in a box given to him by his mother. The _____ was the coolest thing he'd ever seen. In a way, she even made it a little bit like _____.<n><n>### One day, Jake found an antique piece of _____ in a box given to her by his mother. The vase was the coolest thing she'd ever seen.<n><n>### Input -:Jake's mom found something special in a old box. The _____ was made from very rare and valuable material _____ wood with gold inlay.She even found the original receipt in an antique shop. The item is _____ a pair of gold cufflinks made in 1915.<n><n>### The piece was the coolest thing _____ had ever seen. In a statement, his mother gave him the _____.<n><n>In a way, she made it a little bit _____.<n><n>She even found the _____ in a antique shop. It was _____ an antique piece of jewelry made in 1965.<n><n>##Input：In a way, she even _____ a little bit like the item. That means she made it look like the old picture.She even _____.<n><n><n>

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Bob is in a dressing room. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:where do you store wine? Choices:  A: attic B: basement C: art show D: church E: bar<n><n>### Response:		The wine was stored in a basement.<n><n>### Input for task C: What's the difference between wine and cheese? A: cheese is hard B: wine tastes fine C: cheese is fine D : wine is soft<n><n>### Response for task C: Cheese is hard<n><n>### Input task E: Which does not belong with cheese? Choices: 1. Bread 2. crackers 3. pudding 4. peanut butter 5. eggs<n><n>### Response task E: pudding<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Demonstration:<n>Input1:Janet has 9 cards than Brenda. Marah has twice as many cards at Janet.How many cards do they have all?<n>Ans1:211<n><n><n>Input2: Pete walked 6 blocks from his house to bus garage in Houston, he rode bus 20 block to post office to get some stamp. Later, he came 6 block back to own place. How many blocks did pet walk in all?<n>Ans2:52<n><n>Input3:There are 10 blue chair, 3 more green chair than blue chair,there are 13 green chairs and blue chair more than white chair.(1). there are blue chairs,green chairs and white chairs 2). there are more blue chair, white chair more than green chair,how many blue chair, green chair, white chair?<n>Ans3:140<n><n><n>Input4:Alannah, Beatrix, Queen, all three are preparing new school year year and parent have given books, Alannah has 30 book, less then Beatrix, Queen have 1/5 book that Alannah have <n>Ans4:140<n>Input5:On Blacks, Martha go to mall to buy clothes for sale 1 jacket, she got 1 free jacket  from 2 jackets, also she got 1 free t- shirt from 3 t- shirts,she decide buy 4 jackets 9 t-shirt<n>Ans5:18<n>Input6:On vlog, voltaire is vlogger, voltaire have 50 viewers on sale, leila have
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:A person with children might have a lot of plastic things in what place? Choices:  A: cupboard B: cabinet C: own home D: everything E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		The person with children might have the plastic things for the children in cupboard. So the correct response is either A or B<n>

Levi receives the first half.<n><n>### Inputs<n>In a small town, the post office receives one package each week. The post office receives three packages in one week. How many packages do the post office receive in eight weeks?<n><n>Answer: 24<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: In a small town, the local diner serves half as much bacon as the town barber. The town barber also serves twice as much bacon as each cashier serves. There are 1433 cashiers in total. If the diner serves twice as much baon as all the town cashiers combined, what is the total number of cashiers?<n><n>Answer: The diner serves the same as the cashiers.<n><n>### More Demonstration<n>Input: A father leaves his daughter and her friend one quarter cup of juice each day they spend the night. The girls decide to share their juice and finish it each day they stay over. If they drink twice the amount of juice in all the days they spend at their grandma's, how many days did they spend at their grandmas last summer?<n><n>Answer: They shared everything, but when they came back, they drank the same amount as always.<n><n>### Solution<n>Input: The post office received 24 packages in 1 week. Next week it received 2 more packages.  A month later it only had 38 packages.  How many weeks did that happen?<n><n>Answer: In 2 months it went from 24 to 38 packages. So, 24 divided by 2 = 12 6+12 = 18 +8 = 26 weeks.<n><n>### The Answer<n>Input: If the diner serves the same amount as the cashiers, then that means the diner is as big as the cashiers combined, because all of the cashiers work in that diner.<n><n>### Question<n> Input: Levi uses exactly half of Alvin's money voucher. How much money did Levi

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a computer other than a desk? Choices:  A: apartment B: table C: school D: office E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. Input: D E <n><n>### Demographic:11,13,17 B C<n><n>### Instream:A: Cars, table, office, apartment B: School, school, desk, office. B<n><n>### Instructors:Where would you put an ipad other than a home. Choices: A: house B: school C: apartment D: school E: desk  <n><n>### Demographics:13,17 C<n><n>### Stream:A: Cars B: School Cars B <n><n>### Streamers:In this example, what does a stream mean?<n><n>### Streams:The stream means choices:  A: desk, Table B:  school, school. C: apartment, school A<n><n>### Demo:<n>In this example, when you see the stream, you are seeing the choices that a student can pick from to answer a question.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>For this question, you need to give the student the choices of all the possible answers. Then, ask the question and get the answer.<n><n>```<n>def solve(question):<n>    q = question # Assign the question the same name as the function<n>    # Write the choices<n>    choices = [input_option for input_option in question.get("choices")]<n>    # Solve the question<n>    return q.solve(context)<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: vegetable market C: ireland D: produce market E: dessert spot<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Option A**:<n><n>Fast food restaurants buy potatoes in bulk and use them in everything from burgers to fries and chips. It's a great source of carbohydrates and vegetable for people who don't really eat vegetables. Fast food restaurants in the US produce more than 4.4 billion US gallons of potato juice per year.<n><n><n><n>**Option B**:<n><n>A market sells whole and diced potatoes for cooking, boiled potatoes, frozen hash browns, mashed potatoes and patties.<n><n><n><n><n><n>---<n>##### If you find problems in the instructions, please raise an issue [here](https://github.com/SherryCheng123/Replit/issues).<n><n>---<n>### Features<n><n>-   [Repl.it](/replit/)<n>-   [Bot](/bots/)<n>-   [Chat](/chat/)<n>-   [Kubernetes](/kubernetes/)<n>-   [Databases](/databases/)<n> <n>-   [Documentation](/doc/)<n>-   [Tutorial](/tutorials/)<n>-   [Support](/help/)<n><n>---<n>**If you find any bugs or problems on this README file, please submit a PR or raise an issue here:**🤝🏼📧<n><n>---
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? B<n><n>### Input.:In which country is the town of Hanoi? Choices:  North Vietnam South Vietnam Laos Thailand<n><n>### Response.:South Vietnam<n>

Choices:  A: band B: music room C: college D: university E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Input:Bill bought a piano but didn't had room to put it.<n><n>### Input.A: Bill bought an upright but didn't have room where? <n><n>### Response.A: He didn't have a room.<n><n>### Solution.<n><n>The input tells us that Bill bought an uprights piano. Since we know Bill bought a piano it tells us that upright piano is sold in the market. This is the information the input is intended to convey not the piano Bill bought. The response must not include Bill.<n><n>In the response, we are not writing a narrative but we are writing instructions that we are giving to someone. Thus we should leave out the specific information that is not needed by the specific person we are addressing.<n><n>### Example 2<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Multiple choice questions should be answered with words. <n><n>### Each questions should contain 2 or more answer choices.<n><n>### If you are writing an answer to an English exam then you should write your answers in English.

Choices:  A: square shape B: different sizes C: flowers D: doors and windows E: high walls<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is:  D: doors and windows<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>I got this from one of your tasks.<n>The correct answer is:<n>The correct answer is always _D: doors and windows_.<n><n><sub>Explanation:</sub><n>You could ask, "Are these rooms facing east, west, north, or south?" or "Are these rooms corner rooms, straight rooms, or double bedrooms?" and so on. The answer is never _A: square shape_.<n><n>I got the first three tasks from your book. I think they're for 5th graders, but they're too easy for me.<n><n><sub>P. S.:</sub> I hope that you're having a good day.<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>This is a list of values that can be used in an input to the machine. They must be separated by commas because each value is passed to the machine in one input. (One input accepts just one value.)<n><n><n><n>

Below, choose one.<n><n><n>### Instructions:  Answer the following essay question.<n>### Essay Question:  How did you learn about the word you chose? Does hearing it in a story, or reading it in a novel, or seeing it in signage change your thoughts about it in any way? <n>### Minimum of 200 words and no maximum. <n><n>### Demostration 1<n>In this example, the student’s response is: Answer: In today’s age of social media, our English teachers do not have the time to teach us the nuances of language and diction, and we resort (resort = use when there is no other way, e.g., to the library), to the internet. I found your website when I was searching for ways to improve my writing skills. There isn’t much time to spare for writing essays when there are so many interesting things to see on online. We don’t make much time for books anymore, and I’ve been inspired by your story to re-examine (examine = investigate, look at, research, analyze, discuss, compare).<n><n>### Demosration 2<n>In this example, each student’s response is to the same question, but in their own words and in their own unique tone.<n><n>### Input and Output<n>Below is the input and output of a request.<n><n>## Input:<n>A few words of praise, such as a letter or postcard, or perhaps a call, can go a long way (go a long way = make a large difference or impact). The next time you express your gratitude to someone, keep this old proverb in mind (proverb = A succinct and pithy expression of a traditional and/or widely accepted wisdom or truth), and see how it can improve (improve = make more valuable) your next interaction (interaction = how you react when

The first answer is incorrect, the second is correct. How many answers are there for (  4 x 3)?<n><n>#### Response: 3<n><n>#### Input: A teacher wants to use a classroom's money for a class project.  There is exactly $930.75 in the classroom  The teacher takes out $790.75 for the project.  How much money did the teacher take?<n><n>#### Response: $140.00<n><n>#### Input: Each of seven students takes the same exam. After the exam is scored, the teacher gives a class average score of 90%, rounded to the nearest tenth of a percentage point.  What score did the class average?<n><n>#### Response : 90.40<n><n>#### Input : The 5-digit numbers 76512 and 102539 are anagrams, which means they are in the same order  but different ways of arranging the same digits.  76512 spells MENTAL.<n><n>#### Response: The digits are 64853.<n><n>#### Input: What numbers have a difference of 111 with a 3?<n><n>#### Response 27 | 37<n><n>#### Input : What is the 10,000th digit in the Fibonacci series, rounded off to the nearest 100th?<n><n>#### Response The 10,010th digit<n><n>#### Input: The 2 biggest numbers in the table add up to 9,090. What are the two numbers?<n><n>#### Response.50 and    900<n><n>#### Example: The value of a single letter in the sentence is its place in the alphabetical order. What is the value of the letter X in the sentence, "The letter X is in the middle of the alphabet."?<n><n>#### Answer:The letter X is the 24th letter in the alphabet.<n><n><n><n>

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:If a person does something to hurt someone else, they might do what? It is fair for them to get the punishment they deserve. Even if the more serious crime they are admitting to is a harsh punishment.<n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: At a gathering, it was reported that 26 people took wine, 22 people took soda, and 17 people took both drinks. If each person could have taken one or more drinks regardless of what was reported, how many people altogether were at the gathering?<n>Answer: 31<n><n>### Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? Choices:  A: hang in closet B: sniff C: get dirty D: become soiled E: air out<n><n>### Response:		A or B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the option that best completes each statement that is in a form suitable for inclusion in a class.<n><n>### Response Format<n><n>**The following instructions are for **  <n>your teacher.<n><n>Please do not print this page for students.<n>Instead, select 'Print Selection' to generate <n>a version of this page with the correct answer.

Olives are generally too bitter to serve on bread, so we should never eat them before other food and keep them in an airtight jar<n><n>### Input<n><n>> 23<n>### Instruction<n><n>> 8213691332019<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>Input 23<n><n>In a day, 8 million people took the subway. Each person took a ride on the morning subway.<n>The first morning subway had 20 more passengers than the second.<n>4 less than twice of the number of people who took the morning ride also rode the subway again that afternoon.<n>The morning ride took 3 less passengers than the afternoon ride.<n>The total number of rides taken was 65294698. Find the number of afternoon rides.<n><n>### Response<n><n>A 241277562 (morning - 6514544 - afternoon 23994918<n><n>### Exaplanation<n><n>The question asks about morning and afternoon rides. There must be 8 million people taking the morning ride, because there must be at least 2 million people in each ride. In the afternoon ride, there are 3 times as much people as in morning. So multiply 4 by 3 and the answer is "4 times as many people", which is 12 million.<n><n><n><n><n>
